meanings.definition: To move the head up and down in agreement or as a sign of understanding.
meanings.sent1: She nodded when asked if she wanted more cookies.
meanings.sent2: The students nodded in class to show they understood the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The dog nodded eagerly when offered a treat.
meanings.sent4: The trees nodded in the breeze, as if agreeing with the wind.
meanings.sent5: Grandpa nodded slowly, his eyes twinkling with approval.

meanings.definition: Past tense of nod, meaning to move the head up and down in agreement or as a sign of understanding.
meanings.sent1: He nodded after hearing the news about the test results.
meanings.sent2: The audience nodded in agreement with the speaker's points.
meanings.sent3: The robot nodded in a mechanical way, mimicking human gestures.
meanings.sent4: The flowers nodded in the garden, acknowledging the sun's warmth.
meanings.sent5: The old clock nodded silently on the wall, marking the passage of time.
